channel.title: Stopping at Stop Signs
channel.description:
This man got out of a ticket by way of physics
“Therefore my argument in the court went as follows: that what he saw would be easily confused by the angle of speed of this hypothetical object that failed to stop at the stop sign. And therefore, what he saw did not properly reflect reality, which was completely different," Krioukov told NBC San Diego.
Read more: http://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2012/04/16/man-escapes-400-traffic-ticket-with-power-physics/?intcmp=trending#ixzz1sIrevets
His paper: http://arxiv.org/pdf/1204.0162v1.pdf
Pretty awesome, right?

@DEFET wrote:

The bible was a good tale in my opinion, but it was made by a man thousands of years ago[/quote]

People like you that bash each other so explicitly are the reason why all this commotion happens in the first place, as well as the ones that enforce their beliefs.

shouldn’t you be disregarding physics and science as a christian evangelical?[/quote]
yerp. gravity iisn’t real btw.[/quote]

We all know that God’s all mighty hand is putting everything into correct position and holding you and me on this earth.
If God didn’t exist you would be floating dead in the space by now.

item.title: Stopping at Stop Signs
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m not a maths wonder, so the 2nd and 3rd arguments pretty much go over my head, but the 4th to me pretty much nails it. The officer couldn’t see the car, and as far as I know the law doesn’t state how long you have to stop.

But as I said, the maths part isn’t my thing. A car can’t decelerate, nor accelerate faster than a certain limit. I assume he took those limits into account?

Read full topic
